column5: Hey guys,  I'm getting a serious bout of "cabin fever", so I am going to get my Ranger prepared for it's first run by washing/waxing it. I have a jar of turtle wax for a car, I am assuming that's alright to use on the fibreglass? Or is there a special type of wax for a boat?  Cheers, *Stoty
It will work fine. Polish away!!! Please feel free to come on over to my place and clean mine up as well.
You pay for the flight, and I'm there!
Meguiars available everywhere.  Use a quality marine wax.  http://www.meguiarsdirect.com/product_deta...?T1=MEG+FLAG+16  I have been pleased with Meguiars ;
Is there a difference between this and car wax?

From what I have been told special ingredients to protect the gel coat.  Really helps with the UV protection.  When I detail our boat it looks and feels amazing.  Lasts a long time.  I have a polishing machine and it cuts down the labour time.
Nice, thanks for the tip. I'll pick up a bottle next time I'm at CT!  Cheers
I even wax our aluminum boat , neighbour thinks I'm nuts   Of course he's right  TB
Meguiars here too. Another 3 months and I can pull out the boat and start spring cleaning.
Pledge,floral scent. Dont laugh,pledge works.Thats what I used all the time and worked great. Just to save you some hassel.Be sure to wipe dry your boat when you take it out of the water.
Only thing I remember bout waxing is....wax on......wax off.
Then three weeks later you have to winterize it again....
Actually it's "Then three weeks later I can put it in the water when the ice finally goes out"
